snippet: The F.B.I said it had arrested the creator of Silk Road, a Web Site that used virtual currency and protected the anonymity of its users.
abstract: Federal Bureau of Investigation says it has arrested Ross Ulbricht, creator of Silk Road Web site that acted as black market version of eBay, using virtual currency and protecting anonymity of its users; started as underground marketplace for drug users, site soon branched out to other illicit goods, including forged documents, becoming safe haven for criminals to do business with more than 100,000 customers.

byline.contributor: Peter Lattman and Noam Cohen contributed reporting, and Jack Begg contributed research.

lead_paragraph: The F.B.I said it had arrested the creator of Silk Road, a Web Site that used virtual currency and protected the anonymity of its users.

headline.main: Arrest in U.S. Shuts Down a Black Market for Narcotics
headline.print_headline: Arrest in U.S. Shuts Down a Black Market for Narcotics
